question.para: What happend with the old nat_flag module parameter?

answer.para: In was removed, as the module internally loads this value from the USRLOC module (see the nat_bflag USRLOC parameter).

question.para: What happend with the old use_domain module parameter?

answer.para: In was removed, as the module internally loads this option from the USRLOC module. This was done in order to simplify the configuration.

question.para: What happend with the old save_noreply and save_memory functions?

answer.para: There functions were merged into the new save(domain,flags) functions. If a reply should be sent or if the DB should be updated also is controlled via the flags.

question.para: Where can I find more about OpenSER?
Where can I post a question about this module?

answer.para: First at all check if your question was already answered on one of our mailing lists:
E-mails regarding any stable &openser; release should be sent to &openserusersmail; and e-mails regarding development versions should be sent to &openserdevmail;.
If you want to keep the mail private, send it to &openserhelpmail;.

question.para: How can I report a bug?

answer.para: Please follow the guidelines provided at: &openserbugslink;.

question.para: What happened to the desc_time_order parameter?

answer.para: It was removed, as its functionality was mmigrate into usrloc module, were there is a parameter with the same name.
